intro: Coccoloba lepidota, commonly known as the velvetleaf coral tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of the Americas, including parts of Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves, which are often covered in a fine, velvety texture. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Coccoloba lepidota is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
